programme.title: NBA Countdown
programme.desc: "NBA Countdown" serves as the primer for game telecasts on the ESPN family of networks. It's highlighted by a lively roundtable discussion and debate of the top storylines around the league. Seats at the table are reserved for folks in ESPN's stable of NBA hosts and analysts, with the latter group imparting wisdom based on their many years of playing experience.

programme.title: NBA Basketball
programme.desc: Victor Wembanyama's Spurs end a two-game set with LeBron James' Lakers. On this date in 1992, David Robinson, the first overall pick in the 1987 draft, posted a 28-point, 14-rebound double-double for San Antonio in a 107-101 loss to Los Angeles.

programme.title: NBA Basketball
programme.desc: All-Star guard Devin Booker and the Suns try to complete a season-series sweep of the Knicks. Phoenix has won 10 of the last 11 meetings after Booker nailed a 3-pointer with 1.7 seconds to play in a 116-113 victory over New York in November.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.desc: Bowl season begins as the Bobcats (9-3) and Eagles (6-6) clash in the Myrtle Beach Bowl. Ohio is 4-0 in bowl games since 2017. Georgia Southern qualified for the postseason for a second straight year under Clay Helton, but has dropped four in a row.

programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: The Gamecocks (8-4) square off with the Ragin' Cajuns (6-6) in the New Orleans Bowl. Louisiana Lafayette needed a 52-21 victory over rival Louisiana Monroe to secure a postseason berth. Jacksonville State makes its bowl debut in its first FBS season.

programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: The Aggies enjoy a home-state advantage when they face the Bulldogs in the New Mexico Bowl. New Mexico State seeks a second straight bowl victory after reaching double-digit wins for the first time in 63 years. Fresno State won this bowl in 2021.

programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: The Red Raiders go up against the Golden Bears in the Independence Bowl. Texas Tech won bowl games by a combined 44 points over the last two years. California qualified for its first bowl since 2019 by winning its final three regular-season contests.

programme.title: Sunday NFL Countdown
programme.desc: This Sunday pregame staple debuted in 1985 and soon became a signature ESPN series. Host Samantha Ponder introduces the features and directs the storylines associated with the day's games, joined by a roster of analysts highlighted by ex-NFL players, coaches and executives including Tedy Bruschi, Randy Moss, Matt Hasselbeck, Rex Ryan and Louis Riddick. Chris Mortensen and Adam Schefter deliver breaking news and injury updates, while reporters at game sites set the scenes.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: Bronny James and the Trojans visit the Tigers. James, son of LeBron, plays his second game since being medically cleared after suffering cardiac arrest in July. The 6-foot-4 guard played 17 minutes in an overtime loss to Long Beach State on Dec. 10.

programme.title: Women's College Basketball
programme.desc: The Lady Demons (4-5) try to halt the run of the No. 7 Tigers (10-1) in an all-Pelican State match. LSU has rattled off 10 straight wins after a season-opening loss to Colorado, and dumped Northwestern State 100-45 last season en route to its title.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The T-Mobile Center hosts a contest between the Pirates (6-4) and Tigers (7-3). The only previous meeting came in the 1992 NCAA Tournament's second round as Seton Hall weathered a 28-point barrage from Anthony Peeler to knock out Missouri 88-71.

programme.title: SportsCenter With Scott Van Pelt
programme.desc: SVP's up at midnight and bringing his unique perspective on games people play to "SportsCenter" viewers. The hourlong, late-night show is driven by the host's self-deprecating wit and passion for sports, with featured elements, including Van Pelt's nightly "1 Big Thing" commentary and a weekly look back at the moments that drove bettors wild in "Bad Beats." The show also delivers what "SportsCenter" fans are used to -- news and highlights, guests and interviews -- but in a different, fast-paced and insightful way.

Greenberg, aka "Greeny," is formerly one-half of ESPN Radio's longtime "Mike & Mike" morning show.

programme.desc: The Hilltoppers (7-5) play the Monarchs (6-6) in the 2023 Famous Toastery Bowl. Western Kentucky is 6-2 in bowl games since 2014, while Old Dominion's lone victory was at the Bahamas Bowl in 2016. Western Kentucky topped Old Dominion 43-20 in 2021.

programme.title: Monday Night Countdown
programme.desc: Previewing the Monday Night Football matchup airing later on ESPN. Host Scott Van Pelt is joined by Ryan Clark, Robert Griffin III, Marcus Spears, Adam Schefter and Michelle Beisner-Buck as they analyze every last morsel of information pertaining to Monday night's combatants, plus discuss the latest news that developed out of Sunday's action.

programme.desc: The No. 1 Jackrabbits continue their bid for a repeat as they face the No. 5 Great Danes in an FCS semifinal matchup. Albany rallied in the fourth quarter of its quarterfinal to knock off No. 4 Idaho. South Dakota State ousted No. 8 Villanova.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The No. 5 Huskies and No. 10 Bulldogs battle in Seattle in a rematch of their 2023 Elite Eight game. UConn won 82-54 en route to claiming its fifth national title. The Huskies' Tristen Newton averages 17 points, 7.2 rebounds and 6.1 assists per game.

programme.title: NFL Matchup
programme.desc: An NFL Films production, "NFL Matchup" is definitely a show for football junkies. Unlike traditional football preview programs, this one gives fans an in-depth look at some of Sunday's games by breaking down the strategy and tactics -- the Xs and Os -- through the exclusive use of team-supplied footage. That type of film study is a forte of former NFL player and executive Louis Riddick and NFL Films producer Greg Cosell, whose work is featured here alongside host Sal Paolantonio.

programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: The nine-time champion Bison (11-3) visit the No. 2 seed Grizzlies (12-1) in the FCS semifinals. North Dakota State piled up 146 points in winning its first three tournament games. Montana seeks its first appearance in the final since 2009.
